about.description:
Go is expressive, concise, clean, and efficient. Its concurrency mechanisms
make it easy to write programs that get the most out of multicore and
networked machines, while its novel type system enables flexible and
modular program construction. Go compiles quickly to machine code yet has
the convenience of garbage collection and the power of run-time reflection.
It's a fast, statically typed, compiled language that feels like a
dynamically typed, interpreted language.
about.summary: The golang bootstrap compiler (use go for the full golang)

name: go1.4-bootstrap
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "go1.4-bootstrap" %}
{% set version = "20171003" %}
{% set n = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  - url: https://storage.googleapis.com/golang/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: f4ff5b5eb3a3cae1c993723f3eab519c5bae18866b5e5f96fe1102f0cb5c3e52
    folder: {{ name }}
    patches:
      - 0001-remove-macosx-version.diff  # [osx]

build:
  number: 1002
  binary_relocation: False
  detect_binary_files_with_prefix: False
  force_ignore_keys:  # [win]
    - c_compiler      # [win]
    - cxx_compiler    # [win]
  # test data links to these DSOs
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - /usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib
    - /usr/lib/libgcc_s.1.dylib
    - libc.so.6

requirements:
  run:
    # Replace with target_platform once conda-forge/conda-smithy#971 is solved
    - {{ pin_subpackage(name.lower()+"_linux-64", exact=True) }}  # [linux]
    - {{ pin_subpackage(name.lower()+"_osx-64", exact=True) }}    # [osx]
    - {{ pin_subpackage(name.lower()+"_win-64", exact=True) }}    # [win]

test:
   files:
     - hello.go
   commands:
     - ${GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP}/bin/go help  # [not win]
     - cmd /c %GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP%\bin\go help   # [win]

     - cmd /c echo x%GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP% NEQ x%CONDA_PREFIX%\{{ name }}  # [win]
     - cmd /c if x%GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP% NEQ x%CONDA_PREFIX%\{{ name }} exit 1   # [win]

outputs:
  # Replace with _{{ target_platform }} once conda-forge/conda-smithy#971 is solved
  - name: {{ name|lower }}_linux-64  # [linux]
  - name: {{ name|lower }}_osx-64    # [osx]
  - name: {{ name|lower }}_win-64    # [win]
    script: build-core.sh   # [not win]
    script: build-core.bat  # [win]
    requirements:
      build:
        {% if not win %}
        - {{ compiler('c') }}
        - {{ compiler('cxx') }}
        - {{ compiler('fortran') }}
        {% else %}
        - {{ n }}toolchain
        {% endif %}
        - perl  # [not win]
    test:
      files:
        - hello.go
      commands:
        - ${GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP}/bin/go help  # [not win]
        - cmd /c %GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP%\bin\go help   # [win]

        - cmd /c echo x%GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP% NEQ x%CONDA_PREFIX%\{{ name }}  # [win]
        - cmd /c if x%GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP% NEQ x%CONDA_PREFIX%\{{ name }} exit 1   # [win]

about:
  home: http://golang.org
  license: BSD-Style
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: {{ name }}/LICENSE
  summary: 'The golang bootstrap compiler (use go for the full golang)'
  description: |
    Go is expressive, concise, clean, and efficient. Its concurrency mechanisms
    make it easy to write programs that get the most out of multicore and
    networked machines, while its novel type system enables flexible and
    modular program construction. Go compiles quickly to machine code yet has
    the convenience of garbage collection and the power of run-time reflection.
    It's a fast, statically typed, compiled language that feels like a
    dynamically typed, interpreted language.
  doc_url: https://golang.org/doc
  dev_url: https://go.googlesource.com/go

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - scopatz
    - sodre

about.summary: The golang bootstrap compiler (use go for the full golang)

commands: cmd /c if x%GOROOT_BOOTSTRAP% NEQ x%CONDA_PREFIX%\go1.4-bootstrap exit 1
